snippet: A California Superior Court judge's decision virtually shutting down the state's check-writing machine sent the Legislature scurrying today to pass an $18.9 billion short-term budget bill.    The bill lets the state pay its bills, despite lack of ...
lead_paragraph: A California Superior Court judge's decision virtually shutting down the state's check-writing machine sent the Legislature scurrying today to pass an $18.9 billion short-term budget bill. The bill lets the state pay its bills, despite lack of a complete budget, while lawmakers and Gov. Pete Wilson continue negotiations over a tax cut and school spending for an additional two weeks.
abstract: California Legislature hurriedly passes $18.9 billion short-term budget bill after Superior Court judge's decision virtually shuts down state's check-writing machine (S)

headline.main: National News Briefs; Legislators in California Pass Stopgap Budget Bill
